channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: France to reopen for business as Emmanuel Macron declares 'first victory' over Covid-19
item.description: In an upbeat live TV address on Sunday night, the head of state said virtually all lockdown restrictions for bars, restaurants and cafes would end at the start of this coming week.

item.title: Boris Johnson urges consumers to 'shop with confidence when English high streets reopen TOMORROW
item.description: The Prime Minister visited Westfield shopping centre in East London today ahead of Monday's big retail relaunch for the British economy. He declared himself 'optimistic' about Monday.

item.title: Video of George Floyd's 'murder' shows cop Tou Thao ignoring bystanders' pleas for help
item.description: Horrifying new footage shows Minneapolis cop Tou Thao ignoring bystanders' calls for help as George Floyd died under the knee of Derek Chauvin.

item.title: Man, 20, dies of 'drug overdose' after at least 6,000 hit 'quarantine' raves in Leeds and Manchester
item.description: Greater Manchester Police are investigating after two illegal raves, one in the Carrington area and another in the Oldham area. West Yorkshire Police also crashed a rave by the M1 near Leeds.

item.title: Hero Black Lives Matter supporter who carried injured 'far-right' protester is a personal trainer
item.description: Personal trainer Patrick Hutchinson has taken to social media to claim he was the man who helped the opposition protester during clashes in London yesterday.

item.title: Woman hatches three ducklings from eggs she bought at Waitrose as an experiment to pass time
item.description: Charlie Lello, 29, from Hertfordshire, incubated three Clarence Court duck eggs which she bought from a supermarket. She decided to do it as an experiment while she was furloughed.

item.title: Jessica Mulroney's parents take her kids out to walk their dog as she stays holed up at Toronto home
item.description: Jessica Mulroney, 40, has reportedly holed herself up inside her Toronto home since she was fired from ABC's Good Morning America and had her reality TV show, I Do, Redo, canceled this week.

item.title: The 'iceberg that sunk the Titanic': Looming mound of ice pictured by captain of passing ship
item.description: Captain W Wood of the SS Etonian claimed he captured a picture of the same iceberg that the Titanic struck on April 12, 1912 - two days before the historic disaster which claimed 1,522 lives.

item.title: Trump draws fresh health concerns after he appears to have trouble lifting glass of water
item.description: During the speech on Saturday, Trump started to lift the glass with his right hand but seemed unable to guide it all the way up to his lips, using his left hand to steady the glass.

item.title: Firefighters rescue 83-year-old man from 30ft-deep well
item.description: Professor P N Tyre is an animal lover and wanted to help a cat that was struggling near the well in Chennai in India. His daughter-in-law saw him at the bottom of the well and called fire fighters.

item.title: 30ft long whale dies after becoming stranded for the second time in Welsh estuary
item.description: A 30ft fin whale, nicknamed Henry, has died after it became restranded on a sand bank near the Dee estuary in North Wales.

item.title: Adele attends virtual commemorative service on the three-year anniversary of the Grenfell Tower fire
item.description: The singer, 32, thanked Grenfell United for fighting for 'true justice' during a YouTube memorial to honour the victims of the Grenfell Tower fire on the three-year anniversary of the tragedy on Sunday.

item.title: PICTURED: Atlanta cop Garrett Rolfe who fatally shot Rayshard Brooks outside of Wendy's
item.description: The Atlanta police officers involved in the fatal shooting of Rayshard Brooks after a confrontation in a Wendy's parking lot have been identified, after the incident rocked the city.

item.title: Boris Johnson vows to ensure the Grenfell Tower fire will 'never be repeated'
item.description: Today marks three years since a small kitchen fire in the west London high-rise turned into the most deadly domestic blaze since the Second World War.

item.title: LA 'Susan' is caught smashing neighbor's car with two hammers and telling them 'go back to Mexico'
item.description: Video shows the moment a woman in California attacks her neighbor's car with two hammers and yells at witnesses to 'get the f**k out of this neighborhood' and 'go back to Mexico'.

item.title: Mystery as three kilos of gold worth more than £150,000 is left on a train carriage in Switzerland
item.description: The bag was left in a carriage between St Gallen and Lucerne by the forgetful passenger in October last year. Officials made the find public after a bid to locate the man failed.

item.title: Police appeal for help in finding girl, 15, who went missing on Saturday
item.description: West Yorkshire Police are appealing for help to find a missing 15-year-old teenager from Dewsbury. Ifra Ali,15, was last seen on Saturday evening wearing black jeans and an Armani blouse.

item.title: Black Lives Matter protests take place across the world as activists clash in France
item.description: In Paris footage shows anti-racism protesters fighting with a far-right group on the roof of a seven storey building as they unfurl a banner: 'Justice for the Victims of Anti-White Racism'.

item.title: Revolting moment thug SPITS on a woman enjoying a picnic in Hyde Park
item.description: More than 100 people were arrested in the capital yesterday for offences including violent disorder, assault on officers, possession of an offensive weapon and drunk and disorder.

item.title: Scottish loyalists in Glasgow clash with riot police and hurl missiles
item.description: Peaceful Black Lives Matter protests across the UK today were marred by clashes between rival groups in Glasgow, with BLM supporters and far-right loyalists throwing missiles at each other.

item.title: James Cracknell admits his self-confidence has been lifted after 'coping with divorce and family'
item.description: On Saturday, James Cracknell broke the British indoor rowing marathon record with a time of 2 hours 30 minutes and 37 seconds, shaving two minutes off the existing record.

item.title: Madeleine McCann suspect Christian Brueckner's ex-girlfriend 'goes into hiding in fear for her life'
item.description: The ex-girlfriend of the latest Madeline McCann suspect is hiding for her life after speaking to the police. Nakscije Miftari had an 18-month relationship with Christian Brueckner in 2014.

item.title: The 'social bubble' bursts again!
item.description: TomTom data showed traffic around Liverpool was at 94 per cent of pre-lockdown levels at 4pm today as Britons took to beauty spots amid warm temperatures.

item.title: Reckless moment basejumper throws himself off 150ft cliff narrowly missing unsuspecting couple
item.description: The parachutist jumped at West Bay in Dorset unaware of the couple standing on the rocks below. A woman drew her hands to her mouth in shock as he narrowly avoided her

item.title: San Francisco 'Karen' calls the cops on man who wrote Black Lives Matter on his own property
item.description: A 'Karen' who called the cops on a man who chalked Black Lives Matter on his own San Francisco property was identified as Lisa Alexander, owner of LA Face.

item.title: French navy ESCORT boat with 15 more migrants into British waters
item.description: The migrants' small dinghy was escorted by the French navy boat Abeille Languedoc and was intercepted by UK Border Force in the English Channel.

item.title: Children's basic right to education has been put at risk
item.description: Anne Longfield, the Children's Commissioner for England, warned that failure to re-open schools and classrooms limited to 15 pupils threatens the right to guaranteed education.

item.title: Virginia Roberts brands 'insidious' Prince Andrew a 'toad'
item.description: Venting her frustration, she said: 'Oh the gull of this toad - he regrets the BBC interview but not his "friendship" with Epstein because it gave him "great contacts" and much more.'

item.title: Pakistan expects to see a MILLION covid-19 cases by end of July
item.description: Pakistan currently has confirmed nearly 140,000 cases of COVID-19, which is likely under reported due to testing limitations, and the death toll is approaching 2,700.

item.title: World's biggest container vessel HMM Algeciras arrives in the UK for the first time
item.description: HMM Algeciras has arrived in the UK for the first time after concluding its journey from China to Essex, travelling via South Korea, the Netherlands, Germany and Belgium.

item.title: Hank Williams Jr.'s daughter Katherine dead at age 27 after rollover car crash
item.description: The fatal accident occurred Saturday night in Henry County Tennessee, where Katherine's car began drifting across the center median and subsequently rolled over, according to TMZ .

item.title: Social media users show monuments 'attacking' THEM in opposition to 'racist' landmarks campaign
item.description: Former British soldier Ian Inglis posted a series of tongue-in-cheek images on social media, which have gone viral and been shared more than 20,000 times in the last 48 hours by pro-statue supporters.

item.title: Bollywood star Sushant Singh Rajput is found dead in his Mumbai apartment, aged 34
item.description: Actor Sushant Singh Rajput has been found dead in his Mumbai apartment. The 34-year-old was one of Bollywood's biggest personalities, with police investigating an alleged suicide.

item.title: Shadow minister David Lammy criticises fellow Labour MPs over 'facile' racism row with Priti Patel
item.description: David Lammy criticised a group led by Vauxhall MP Florence Eshalomi for accusing the Home Secretary of 'gaslighting' them over her own experience of racism.

item.title: Couple wrongly arrested over Gatwick drone Christmas chaos in 2018 receive £200,000 in compensation
item.description: Sussex Police said 96 people 'of interest' were identified, researched and ruled out during the Gatwick Airport drone chaos investigation which has cost £790,000.

item.title: Man, in his 50s, dies after being shot outside lockdown party in Essex
item.description: Two women in their 20s were also taken to hospital with single gunshot wounds following the 'drive by' attack in Roydon, near Harlow on Saturday morning.

item.title: Man, 28, is arrested for urinating on memorial to murdered PC Keith Palmer in Westminster
item.description: A man has been arrested in Essex on suspicion of outraging public decency after he was allegedly photographed urinating next to a memorial to PC Keith Palmer.

item.title: Mail on Sunday launches petition over Winston Churchill statue
item.description: The Mail on Sunday today calls on our readers to help block any attempt to remove the statue of Sir Winston Churchill from outside the Houses of Parliament.

item.title: Winston Churchill's picture mysteriously vanishes from Google's list of British Prime Ministers
item.description: Churchill's image has disappeared from the carousel. All other prime ministers are still pictured. It comes as Black Lives Matter protesters call for his image to be torn down in Westminster.

item.title: Woman reveals her amazing hack to get rid of dried paint stains on fabric with hand sanitiser
item.description: Lancashire-based cleaning enthusiast 'Mrs D' revealed on Instagram how she got rid of paint stains on carpet using a bottle of hand sanitizer with 80 per cent alcohol., for immaculate results.

item.title: CBeebies' Jojo and Gran Gran praised for celebrating diversity
item.description: Viewers have praised CBeebies show JoJo & Gran Gran - the first British-made animated TV show centered around the lives of a black family.

item.title: Kent Police hunt for driver who tried to snatch boy, 12, after asking him for directions on seafront
item.description: Police say the worrying incident that left the boy 'distressed' happened in Sandgate, near Folkestone, Kent.

item.title: Attack on girl in Praia da Luz forms part of German inquiries
item.description: Portuguese police have been asked to send on details of the 2005 assault, Hans Christian Wolters, the prosecutor heading the investigation, confirmed.

item.title: Welcome to the Johnson family
item.description: Stanley Johnson, 79, said he had spoken with his granddaughter Stephanie, 11, in two video calls and hoped to meet her once the coronavirus lockdown is over.

item.title: Tricky brainteaser challenges puzzlers to find the lipstick amongst the lips
item.description: A tricky new brainteaser, created by Professional Beauty Direct, has challenged the nation to find the lipstick hidden amongst the lips - but will you beat the impressive 15 second record?

item.title: Westminster School is accused of a 'toxic culture' of racism by 250 former pupils
item.description: More than 250 black alumni of Westminster School, in central London, signed a letter urging the establishment to incorporate the teaching of black culture into the curriculum.

item.title: Britain's coronavirus death toll rises by just 36 - the lowest since before lockdown
item.description: Department of Health bosses announced a further 36 fatalities in people with a positive Covid-19 test result across all settings, taking the Government total to 41,698.

item.title: 'Evil seems to reign supreme': Pope Francis urges Christian faithful to 'fill your hearts with hope'
item.description: In a message delivered today for the 4th World Day of the Poor, Pope Francis said: 'Bad news fills newspapers, websites and television screens, to the point that evil seems to reign supreme.

item.title: Boris must cure the perilous cabin fever that's gripped Britain
item.description: Those who stir up hatred and intolerance will find that it rebounds on them. If you have yourself chosen lawlessness, vandalism and destruction, you have licensed others to do the same.

item.title: Woman, 25, claims primer made from Nordic bark helped to dramatically improve her acne in just weeks
item.description: Daisy Welch, 25, from Milton Keynes, who was called 'pizza face' due to her acne, has told how she found an unlikely solution in the form of a £12.50 primer made from Nordic bark.

item.title: Inmates boast about 'village shop' prison cells with extraordinary collection of stockpiled food
item.description: Prisoners have been gloating on social media about their comfortable lifestyles as they post pictures of TVs, games consoles and food stockpiles in their prison cells.

item.title: Murder probe is launched after man, 48, is stabbed to death at home in north London
item.description: A 42-year-old man has been arrested on suspicion of murder after a man, 48, died from stab injuries. The man is thought to be known to the victim.

item.title: Tesco praised for including domestic violence helpline number on receipts
item.description: A picture of a bill from the British supermarket was shared on Twitter by journalist Scott Bryan , and was lauded as incredibly helpful and brave by social media users.

item.title: Richard Caring warns PM's 'indecision' on reopening restaurants, pubs could cost two million jobs
item.description: Richard Caring has launched a blistering attack on the Government, warning Boris Johnson's 'weakness and indecision' on reopening businesses will cost more than two million workers their jobs.

item.title: Face masks are more protective against Covid-19 than handwashing, study suggests
item.description: US warship Theodore Roosevelt has been studied by US officials. They found a 25 per cent difference in the number of people infected between those who did and didn't wear a mask.

item.title: Female pedestrian found dead on the M20 after being hit by car in early hours of the morning
item.description: Police have launched an appeal after the body of a woman in her early 20s was found lying in the carriageway at junction 10a (Ashford) of the M20 at 3.10am on Sunday morning.

item.title: Lancet editor blasts government for allowing thousands of needless coronavirus deaths
item.description: Dr Richard Horton, who has been editor-in-chief of the prestigious Lancet for 25 years, said people have died as a result of 'appalling misjudgements'.

item.title: German police hunt letters suspect Christian Brueckner may have written mentioning Madeleine McCann
item.description: German police probing into the life of Christian Breuckner are hunting for the supposed letters and have asked ex-girlfriends for notes the convicted sex offender may have sent them in the past.

item.title: Britain's youngest lottery winner Jane Park SLAMS 'people who use others for money'
item.description: Britain's youngest millionaire Jane Park, 24, from Edinburgh, has taken to Instagram and told how it isn't 'cool' to 'use someone for money and then boast about it on social media.'

item.title: Kate Middleton is being 'watched carefully' by the Queen and Prince Philip
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are being 'watched closely' by senior royals including the Queen and Prince Philip, royal author Tom Quinn has claimed.

item.title: Rishi Sunak reveals 'upsetting' racist abuse he suffered as a child
item.description: Chancellor Rishi Sunak, 40, appearing on Sophy Ridge on Sunday, said he wanted to 'protect' his younger siblings from the abuse he received while growing up in Southampton.

item.title: Daughter receives instructions to throw a party for her mother sent by her dad who died in 2019
item.description: Alyssa Mendoza, from Manila, revealed her father, who passed away in 2019, sent her an email with instructions on how to throw her mother a surprise wedding anniversary party.

item.title: Sheikh Al-Maktoum's racehorses became part of venomous divorce battle
item.description: The sheikh, 70, is one of the world's most successful owners and breeders and keeps thoroughbreds at his Godolphin stables near Newmarket.

item.title: Ministers fear top scientists Chris Whitty and Patrick Vallance could quit over two-metre rule
item.description: Professor Chris Whitty, the popular Chief Medical Officer, and Chief Scientific Adviser Sir Patrick Vallance have made it clear they believe the current guidance on safe distancing should stay.

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are the 'big losers' in the Royal Family, claims royal author
item.description: Speaking to The Express, royal author Phil Dampier claimed Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's lack of presence amid the coronavirus pandemic has seen their fans lose interest back in the UK.

item.title: New Zealanders pack out Eden Park in biggest super rugby crowd for 15 years
item.description: Sunday's match was another joyous celebration of the return of live rugby, following Saturday's opening match in Dunedin between home team the Highlanders and the Hamilton-based Chiefs.

item.title: Savvy mum creates bespoke furniture using old TYRES and string
item.description: Alicia Mellor, 48, from South Yorkshire, creates stunning one-of-a-kind household pieces using tyres and string. She spends just £6 to £35 on each creation and sources most materials for free.

item.title: London braces for chaos as hooligans and far-right thugs threaten clashes with BLM protesters
item.description: Police chiefs imposed the 5pm curfew in a bid to quell the unrest seen throughout the day as the anti-racist rally and a pro-statue counter-protest descended into hooliganism in London.

item.title: Britain faces record 4.5million unemployed with one in three firms warning of redundancies
item.description: Boris Johnson has told cabinet members to brace for a spike in unemployment figures, which could reach the highest number since records began, reports The Sunday Times .

item.title: Melania Trump told staff: 'Stop calling me first lady' after her husband's shock election victory
item.description: Melania Trump was so uncomfortable in her new role she asked staff to stop calling her 'first lady', according to a new book out on Tuesday. Melania also avoided the White House as long as possible.

item.title: Councils ordered to REOPEN public toilets after they were closed for lockdown
item.description: The Government has told councils to reopen their public toilets which have been closed since lockdown began as retailers begin to welcome shoppers back to the nation's high streets.

item.title: Married couple waiting for children 'didn't realise they needed to have sex first'
item.description: Rachael Hearson, 59, has been an NHS nurse, midwife and health visitor for more than 40 years. Her new book reveals shocking, touching and hilarious stories from her time as a health visitor.

item.title: Bold moment frustrated mother-of-three confronts two 'flytipping' workmen
item.description: Andrea Good, 42, saw a vehicle pull up outside a gate to her field in Woodlands in the New Forest National Park and ran over and began recording when she saw what was going on.

item.title: Britons face being banned from visiting America for MONTHS
item.description: The current travel ban for UK tourists which has been in place since March 16 will likely be lifted in months rather than weeks, senior US virus expert Dr. Anthony Fauci said.

item.title: Meghan Markle's mother Doria 'joins Duchess, Harry and Archie at their rented home in Los Angeles'
item.description: Doria, a former social worker, is acting as an 'unofficial nanny' to one-year-old grandson Archie at Prince Harry and Meghan Markle's rented £8million mansion in Los Angeles.

item.title: Prince Harry opens up over death of his mother Princess Diana with a terror attack survivor
item.description: Owen Richards, now 21, from the West Midlands, has spoken to The Mirror and told how Prince Harry, 35, helped him deal with his grief after three of his family members were killed.

item.title: Coronavirus tests could be carried out at work under Matt Hancock's plans
item.description: The Health Secretary has said officials are in talks with British businesses about how they could run their own testing programmes as the re-open.

item.title: What type of shopper are YOU? Stylist reveals how to avoid common shopping pitfalls
item.description: British stylist Susie Hasler, who runs Styled By Susie, has revealed which type of shopper you are and the advantages and pitfalls of each style - from the bargain hunter to the social shopper.

item.title: Police forces EIGHT times more likely to fire Tasers
item.description: Officers in Humberside and Durham are the most trigger-happy, discharging their Tasers at more than twice the rate of those in London, despite being far more rural regions.

item.title: China reports 57 new virus cases as Beijing cluster grows
item.description: China has reported 57 new cases of the coronavirus today, the highest daily figure since April, as 36 of the cases are linked to to Xinfadi market in south Beijing - which has since been closed.

item.title: Boris Johnson is set to announce primary pupils from ALL years can return before summer
item.description: Under new plans expected to be unveiled this week schools will be given the green light to return as many children to classes as safely possible as soon as possible.

item.title: Are scientists about to reverse their support for 'good' HDL cholesterol?
item.description: New research into HDL cholesterol has questioned its status as being 'good' for heart health and in high concentrations can even cause problems and possible increase the risk of an attack.

item.title: New York 'Karen' not wearing face mask is caught on camera coughing over a customer in a bagel shop
item.description: A customer was inside a New York bagel shop and not wearing a face mask when a fellow patron asked staff in store why they didn't insist on masks for everyone. It incensed her and she lashed out.

item.title: How the other halves of David Tennant and Michael Sheen are the real winners from lockdown BBC hit
item.description: David Tennant and Michael Sheen z have won plaudits for their BBC1 series, Staged, filmed in lockdown where they appear alongside their partners Georgia Tennant and Anna Lundberg.

item.title: Top universities warn students will lose their place if they defer
item.description: As research says over 40 per cent of sixth-formers are considering deferring until 2021, universities such as Oxford have told teenagers they will have to start their degrees this autumn (file photo).

item.title: This woman has made 200 people millionaires
item.description: Holly Tucker, the creative mastermind behind the juggernaut website Not On The High Street, tells Julia Llewellyn Smith about overcoming her own tough times
